description:
T1 - declining / dead Horse Chestnut left hand front boundary - branches have and continue in strong winds to land on our vehicles/home / neighbours causing major damage resulting in avoiding parking cars on this side of driveway when weather is poor but this is access to our garage.
T2 - Yew road side boundary - reduce height by up to 1m and reduced lateral growth over pavement by up to 2m - pedestrians on road have complained re: the tree growing to block the pathway and local bus company have verbally mentioned concerns of it growing towards road
T3 - Holm Oak reduce height and lateral growth by up to 1m to maintain size, balance and shape, thin by 15%
T4 - Sycamore next to right hand gate, fell to ground level and grind stump. Trees root have lifted tarmac on pavement in public space and pedestrians have expressed upset as they have tripped and one was considering suing me as she stated she developed a colles fracture after tripping ! However I did not hear from them further.
